detailedRequirements:
EnerWise is your personal energy concierge. It is also a web application that guides a homeowner / home buyer through the process of analyzing their home’s current/expected energy usage and potential savings from adding solar and performing energy efficiency upgrades. We then connect the homeowner to the best source of capital and qualified installers to maximize their investment.

For this challenge, the goal is to implement a REST API backend and wire it up the provided AngularJS HTML prototype.

Challenge Requirements

You will address the following :

Technology Stack

You will use the follow stack in this challenge

  • - Express.JS 4.0

  • - Postgres (latest stable version)

  • - AngularJS

  • - Node.JS (latest stable version)

  • - Nginx (as reverse proxy)

  • - Async module is a must.

  • - Use underscorejs if needed

  • - nodemailer for sending emails

Model Definition

  1. - user

    1. - id (primary id)

    2. - role : home_owner, financier, realtor, energy_installer, or admin

    3. - email

    4. - password (hashed and salted)

    5. - first_name

    6. - last_name

    7. - company (optional)

    8. - utility_referral_id

  2. - user_social_account

    1. - user_id

    2. - type (facebook, twitter, g+)

    3. - token

    4. - identifier

  3. - admin

    1. - email

    2. - password

  4. - houses

    1. - house_id

    2. - address

    3. - city (lookup)

    4. - state (lookup)

    5. - zip

    6. - status (pending/completed)

  5. - house_info

    1. primary (house_id)

    2. houses_of_interest (array of house_id’s)

    3. number_of_adults (optional)

    4. number_of_children (optional)

  6. - user_house

    1. - user_id

    2. - home_info_id

  7. - house_analysis

    1. - house_id (reference id)

    2. - sell-rate

    3. - system-cost

    4. - image

    5. - solar_production (array of 12 items, each item represents a month of the year set in the record, the value is the production in kWh)

    6. - solar_production#image.

  8. - financier_customer

    1. - financier_user_id (reference to financier user)

    2. - user_id

    3. - home_info_id

  9. - utilities (lookup)

    1. - Name

    2. - service_type (electricity,gas,water,fuel_oil)

    3. - URL

Note the following :

  • You can add more models as needed, and suggest changes to the models above.

  • Roles : in this portal only Homeowners, Financiers and Admins can login. Realtors and Installers will have their own UI soon. Your solution is preferred to be flexible to add more roles in future.

REST API

  • The backend will be REST API communicating with angularjs in frontend.

  • The code must be organized into controllers, each controller/endpoint should be a self-contained functionality (i.e. controller for user management (login, signup, .. etc), controller for homeowner dashboard .. etc)

  • List of endpoints you need to address the requirements (you can suggest changes or add more endpoints to address requirement) :

    • - POST /signin to handle login

    • - GET /signin/{socialnetwork} to handle social network

    • - POST /signup to handle sign up

    • - POST /forgotpassword to handle forgot password

    • - GET /resetpassword to handle resetting the password, this is the link to be sent to user email .

    • - GET /user - to get user account information

    • - PUT /user - to update user account information

    • - GET /home/{id} to get home address information

    • - GET /home/{id}/analysis to get home analysis information

    • - PUT /home/{id}/analysis to update home analysis

    • - POST /home to create home

    • - PUT /home to update home

    • - GET /homes/?type={type} to get list of homes the current user can access, type can be completed or pending

    • - GET /home/{id}/analysis/export?type=pdf to export pdf

    • - GET /utilityapi/callback (to handle callback from utilityapi)

  • - Add proper role authorization validation to access each endpoint.

  • - Logging, validation, and error handling must be properly implemented.

Backend and Pages Requirements

  1. - Landing Page

    • - page : #/landing

    • - The four widget’s ‘Create Account’ takes user to Signup page.

    • - Sign in in header takes user to login page.

  2. - Signup

    • - page: #/signup

    • - If navigation to page came from Homepage then type should be selected based on selection from Homepage.

    • - User can select a type from the page.

    • - Implement validation in frontend and backend as done in the UI prototype.

    • - Backend will create new user record and redirect user to #/thankyou page

    • - Send user welcome email :

      • - nodemailer options should be configurable.

      • - email template should be configurable.

  3. - Login

    • - Page : #/signin

    • - Implement validation as done in UI prototype in both frontend and backend.

    • - User should be able to login using social network accounts.

    • - User passport.js to implement login functionality

    • - For facebook/google :

      • - If user with identifier exists then login the user.

      • - else If user with email exists then create new user_social_account record

      • - else if user with email does not exist redirect user to sign up and pre-fill signup form from data pulled from the social network, on successful registration user and user_social_account should be created

      • - redirect user to proper dashboard based on user type.

    • - For twitter

      • - if user with identifier exists then login the user.

      • - else redirect user to sign up form, pre-fill form with data pulled from twitter, on successful registration user and user_social_account should be created

      • - redirect user to proper dashboard based on user type.

    • - For failed attempts, lockout after 10 login attempts and log that.

  4. - Logout

    • - Hovering on top right corner will open a div with logout button.

    • - Implement logout functionality, it will redirect user to landing page.

  5. - Forgot Password

    • - Page : #/reset

    • - Add proper validation for email as done in the UI prototype in both frontend and backend.

    • - Use nodemailer to send emails.

    • - The templates should be configurable.

    • - The nodemailer options should be configurable.

    • - If user with email exists it should send reset password email.

    • - There should be an expiration date >= 48 hrs for the reset password functionality.

    • - If user with email does not exists then return error and display popup same as done in the UI prototype.

    • - On successful forgot password flow redirect user to a page similar to  #/thankyou  page with message stating that “Email has been successfully sent, check your email.” and add link to Login page.

  6. - Reset Password

    • - This page should look like Forgot Password page.

    • - It should contain two input fields to provide a new password and to re-type new password.

    • - Validation for the reset password link and it’s expiry date must be applied here.

    • - On successful execution redirect user to login page.

    • - If link is invalid or expired return user to page similar to #/thankyou with proper message displayed “Reset password is invalid” or “Reset password link has expired”.

  7. Homeowner Dashboard

    • - Page : #/homeowner

    • - Home Info Tab

      • - Personal Info tab

        1. - It will load content from User table

        2. - User should be able to update information

        3. - Validation for email and password should be applied here, same rules as in signup form.

        4. - Create/Update to backend will be applied when clicking “Next”

      • - Utility Info tab

        1. - Change this tab to show the following :

        2. - Utility Name Drop Down menu populated from Utilities lookup table : [Pacific Gas & Electric (PG&E), Southern California Edison (SCE), San Diego Gas & Electric (SDG&E), Other]

          1. - If PG&E is selected embed Utilities#URL in iframe beneath the dropdown menu (see below for instructions and example)

          2. - If SCE is selected embed Utilities#URL in iframe beneath the dropdown menu (see below for instructions and example)

          3. - If SDG&E is selected embed Utilities#URL in iframe beneath the dropdown menu (see below for instructions and example)

        3. - Embed UtilityAPI widget in an iFrame (similar to how it is done in this page http://ca-solar.com/bills).

          1. - The url to be embedded should be configurable, it is something like this (you can find in your dashboard and you need to use the demo version to test).

          2. - You need to create a public endpoint to handle callback from the authorization page. The callback will return a ‘referrals’ field to be used later in get user information.

          3. - Referral should be stored in database.

          4. - Using

        4. - Clicking on the button will take user to authorization flow to authorize the application.

        5. - On successful authorization the page should be display the user’s utility api account information displayed and message in top of the tab static that “Thank you! You have successfully connected your UtilityAPI Account.”.

          1. - Using referrals field from returned in Utilityapi callback, make a call to the utilityapi to get account information :

            1. - https://utilityapi.com/api/accounts.json?access_token=<access-token>&referrals=<referrals>

        6. -  For existing user we will not display the button, instead we will display the account id associated with user account.

        7. - refer to UtilityAPI for documentation.

        8. - UtilityAPI api access token should be configurable.

        9. - The collected info should be created/updated in User on clicking “next”.

      • - Primary Home Address tab

        1. - Information will be populated/stored from/in home_info#primary.

        2. - If there is a primary home address for customer it should be populated.

        3. - Display “View Analysis” only if existing home address status is Completed.

        4. - Call to backend to create/update information will be done when clicking “Next”.

        5. - the house information will be stored in home_info.primary field.

        6. - State should be loaded from lookup table.

        7. - Add validation for zipcode in frontend/backend.

        8. - Add validation for state in backend.

      • - Home Of Interest Tab

        1. - User can provide zero or more home addresses in this tab.

        2. - This tab list all home addresses associated with the User from home_info#houses_of_interest field.

        3. - For new user this page will be empty with only “Add House” button, clicking on the button will add new House form.

        4. - Users can add as many Houses as they want.

        5. - Houses will be stored in backend when user click on “Update Information”.

        6. - “View Analysis” only displayed for Completed home addresses entries.

        7. - the houses will be stored in home_info#houses_of_interest array field.

    • - Home Analysis Tab

      • - This tab display home analysis information for selected home address.

      • - We will add Financing and Potential Payback of Loan sections to Homeowner’s view of this tab.

      • - On this tab, user will have the option to change the address of what analysis to view by selecting from the dropdown field. This drop down will only display completed home addresses.

      • - If selected House status is Pending then display a bootstrap alert message with statement “Report is not yet finished, it can take up to 48 hours to complete. You’ll receive an email when it’s done.”

        1. - user same message styling as in “Home Info” tab.

      • - For “Completed” house, render the home_analysis data in the page.

        1. - Retrieve home_analysis record of the home address.

        2. - Read the solar_production record of current year.

        3. - Set image from retrieved solar_production#image field.

        4. - The column bar chart should be changed to side-by-side column instead of stacked columns.

        5. - The column bar chart data will be calculated as follow :

          1. - Retrieve the current year house data (12 months) for both utility api and the electricity rate.

            1. - use utilityAPI #/intervals endpoint to get electricity usage.

            2. - aggregate data by month for the last 12 months

            3. - use utilityAPI bills endpoint to get user bills.

            4. - group bills information by date and get the last 12 months bills and calculate bill_total for each month.

          2. - Retrieve the current year data (12 months) for both solar production and the seller rate.

            1. - Multiply each month by the seller-rate.

          3. - Return the data in two dimensional array.

          4. - The blue column represents the solar data, while the green represents the utility data.

            1. - Usage is aggregated monthly utilityapi interval data in green, and the blue is the calculated solar_production data.

        6. - The “Annual Savings” div will be calculated as = total earnings in that year - total bills from utility api in that year.

      • - Clicking on “Find vendors and financing for me” will send email for support.

        1. - It sends email to configurable email address

        2. - Email body will be the following text “<user#firstname> <user#lastname> at <house#address> is interested in adding solar to their roof. Their email address is <user#email_address>. ”

        3. - It sends email to homeowner with the following text “Dear <first_name>, We are looking for the best installers and financing sources for you right now and will be in touch shortly with more information and/or question. Best regards, The EnerWise Team”

        4. - The sender (contact information) should be included in the email.

        5. - Store the request in database, this requires new table.

      • - Financing section

        1. - The system cost is pulled from database.

        2. - Federal tax is configurable value in percentage, set it to 30% for testing.

        3. - State tax is provided in csv file, you will parse this file and lookup the state tax percentage using the home address zipcode.

        4. - Multiply system cost by federal tax and render the value.

        5. - Multiple system cost by state tax and render the value.

        6. - Estimated cost after incentives will be the system cost less the calculated federal/state tax values.

      • - Potential Payback of Loan section

        1. - Above the “Potential Payback of Loan section” there are set of range input fields for two loan scenarios:

          1. - System Cost in $ from 0 to 50,000 with initial value set to SYSTEM COST from database.

          2. - yearly interest rate in % from 0 to 10, add % unit to label.

          3. - loan term in years from 0 to 30, add years unit to label.

          4. - percentage savings applied to loan payments in % from 0 to 100

        2. - The D3 chart with 2 line graphs, one for loan scenario 1 and one for loan scenario 2

          1. - Chart x and y axis :

            1. - Y-axis is Remaining Value of the loan

            2. - X-Axis is Time from beginning of loan

          2. - To calculate the graph data :

            1. - Variables :

              1. - Estimated System cost = SYS

              2. - Annual Percentage Rate = APR

              3. - Monthly Percentage Rate (MPR) = APR/12

              4. - Loan Term = LTR

              5. - Monthly Savings from Solar = SAV

              6. - % Savings applied to loan = SAL

              7. - X = Month from start of Loan

              8. - Y = Remaining balance of loan

            2. - Formula : Y = SYS(1 - X*( MPR + (MPR/((1+MPR)^(LTR*12)-1)) - (SAV * SAL)*X

            3. - You are provided with sample document that show you the calculations.

        3. - The table below the D3 chart for the loan scenarios will summarize the loans scenario, it will display the time to payoff the loan and the total of 25 year value of installation.

      • - Export to PDF

        1. - Should export the same page without header/footer to PDF with same look and feel on a white background.

        2. - User open source node module to support this functionality.

  8. - Financier Dashboard

    • - Page : #/financier

    • - Your Info Tab

      • - Form will be populated from User model for currently logged in user.

      • - User can update the form with information.

      • - Validation should be done in frontend/backend as in UI prototype.

      • - Validating existing email already exist should be done as well.

    • - Customers tab

      • - User will use this page to manage Customers.

      • - The functionality for adding houses is same as the one done in Homeowner dashboard.

      • - The page will manipulate users and will create association between financing user and the customer user by storing it in customers model.

      • - For each customer, the backend will create a user with ‘home_owner’ type, and create home addresses to be associated with the user, then associate the user with currently logged in financier in customers table.

        1. - If house with address already exist we associate it with the financier in financier_customer table, otherwise we create new house

        2. - If user with email address already exist we associate it with the financier in financier_customer, otherwise we create new user.

      • - Display ‘view analysis’ button only for ‘complete’ home addresses.

      • - Implement endpoint to support adding/removing home addresses.

      • - Status columns represent the house addresses status.

    • - Analysis Tab

      • - This will be same as Homeowner Analysis tab except that we don’t display “Find Vendor and Financier for Home” button.

  9. - Admin Dashboard

    • - Page : #/admin

    • - This page accessed by ‘admin’ user only.

    • - It will list all houses with status “pending”.

    • - All the fields are manually inserted, take into consideration the comma separator, and the dollar sign ($) for money field.

      • - Proper validation for digits should be added in backend, user don’t need to add the dollar sign for money fields, it should be appended automatically.

    • - Implement Upload Image functionality, it will store images to a configurable folder over a network.

      • - User can upload multiple times for same house to replace images.

      • - Upload should be done automatically once user click on “Done”.

    • - Clicking “Done” will update house in backend from “pending” to “completed”

      • - Validation is needed to verify image is provided, all fields are filled, and data is populated for that house.

      • - On successful storing of data a successful popup will be displayed and record will be removed from the page.

    • - Information will be stored in home_analysis table. house status will be updated to ‘Completed’.

    • - Use Amazon S3 to store the image and serve it.

General Notes

  • - The UI prototype is responsive, so your solution must work on responsive views as well, you should not break any UI styling or functionality in responsive views.

  • - Provide a readme file for details about deploying the application, configuring it, and testing locally.

Heroku Hosting

The application will be hosted in heroku. You must test your solution in Heroku and provide required scripts and instructions to deploy there.

Documents

Provided in challenge forums :

  • - The UI prototype

  • - Calculation document for the plot chart.

Folder Structure

Root directory     

  • - env-sample (this will be a sample of .env file)

  • - app.js

  • - models

  • - views

  • - controllers

  • - public        

    • - angularjs

    • - css

    • - js

    • - i       

  • - .gitignore

  • - config/ folder

  • - READ.md

  • - anything else needed.
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Deliverables

  • - All source code files and scripts that implement above requirements.

  • - A readme.md file detailing all information needed to setup, configure, and run the app. Use github flavored markup text. It should be part of the git folder submitted

  • - You don't need to submit a word document for deployment guide.

  • - Wor document for verification steps.
